loaders.notSupportedHint: This loader does not support the selected Minecraft version. Choose a different version or loader.

instances.title: Instances
instances.unknownError: Unknown error. Try reinstalling the instance.
instances.name: Name
instances.emptyDescription: Create your first Minecraft instance or install a modpack
instances.serverMemoryHint: For servers: It's recommended to set min = max for stable operation. This prevents delays during heap expansion.
instances.installInfoMessage: After creation, necessary files will be automatically downloaded
instances.loaderNotSupported: Loader doesn't support this Minecraft version

edit.title: Edit Instance
edit.versionWarning: Warning: Changing versions requires downloading new files. After saving, you will be prompted to run instance repair.
edit.name: Name
edit.memoryHint: Recommended: 2048-4096 MB for modpacks, 2048 MB for vanilla

repairDialog.title: Run repair?
repairDialog.message: Minecraft version or loader has been changed. It is recommended to run instance repair to download necessary files.

edit.javaAutoHint: Will use Java from launcher settings

recommendations.title: Recommended for you
recommendations.empty: No recommendations yet. Install more mods!

appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.dimmingHint: Dims the background for better readability

management.title: Java Management
management.downloadHint: Java is downloaded from Adoptium (Eclipse Temurin)

gpu.title: Graphics Card
gpu.multipleGpusHint: On laptops with hybrid graphics, it's recommended to select the discrete GPU for better performance

launchBehavior.description: What to do with launcher when game is running
launchBehavior.minimizeToTrayHint: Launcher will hide to system tray

java.title: Java Management
java.allUsed: All Java versions are in use

clearCache.title: Clear cache?
clearCache.message: This is safe, but some data will need to be re-downloaded.

resetSettings.title: Reset settings?
resetSettings.message: All settings will be reset to default values.

logAnalyzer.title: Log Analyzer
logAnalyzer.analyzeExternalHint: Open a log file from any location
logAnalyzer.exportArchiveOnlyInstances: Archive export is only available for instances
logAnalyzer.exportArchiveUnavailable: Archive export is temporarily unavailable. Use JSON export.

conflictPredictor.noConflicts: No conflicts detected. Mod can be safely installed.

crashHistory.title: Crash History
crashHistory.noTrends: Not enough data for trend analysis
crashHistory.confirmClear: Are you sure you want to clear crash history?

liveCrash.title: Live Monitoring
liveCrash.notMonitoringDesc: Monitoring is inactive. Start the game and enable monitoring.

errorReporter.title: Error Reports
errorReporter.checkDuplicates: Please check if this error was already reported
errorReporter.selectToReport: Select errors to include in your GitHub issue report

outofmemory.title: Increase allocated RAM
outofmemory.description: Increase maximum memory in instance settings (6-8GB recommended for modpacks)

outofmemoryTextures.title: Remove HD texture packs
outofmemoryTextures.description: High resolution texture packs (256x+) consume lots of VRAM and RAM

optifine.title: Remove OptiFine
optifine.description: OptiFine is incompatible with Sodium/Iris/Rubidium. Use Sodium + Iris for shaders

missingDependency.title: Auto-install dependencies
missingDependency.description: Use 'Resolve Dependencies' feature to automatically install missing mods

mixinUpdate.title: Update mods
mixinUpdate.description: Mixin conflicts are often fixed in newer mod versions. Check for updates

mixinRemove.title: Remove conflicting mod
mixinRemove.description: If two mods modify the same method via Mixin, one of them needs to be removed

javaVersion.title: Install correct Java version
javaVersion.description: MC 1.17+ requires Java 17+, MC 1.20.5+ requires Java 21. Install the correct version

corrupted.title: Reinstall mod
corrupted.description: Mod file is corrupted. Delete it and download again from Modrinth/CurseForge

config.title: Reset configs
config.description: Delete the config folder to reset settings. Mod will create new configs on startup

kubejs.title: Check KubeJS scripts
kubejs.description: KubeJS errors usually indicate problems in scripts. Check kubejs/startup_scripts/ and kubejs/server_scripts/

knowledgeBase.didItHelp: Did this solution fix the problem?
knowledgeBase.notesPlaceholder: Describe what worked or didn't work...

performance.title: Performance
performance.installSpark: Install Spark for detailed mod performance analysis
performance.installSparkHint: Install Spark for detailed mod performance analysis
performance.noSparkData: No Spark data. Create a report with /spark profiler
performance.noRecommendations: No recommendations - everything is running well!

download.title: Download mod
download.selectFolderRequired: Please select a folder for download
download.downloadAllHint: Download all mods from second modpack

closeConfirm.title: Close comparison?
closeConfirm.message: Comparison results will be lost. Are you sure you want to close this window?

patch.title: Patches
patch.applyToInstance: Apply a patch to this instance
patch.instanceMustBeStopped: Instance must be stopped to apply patches
patch.createHint: Create a patch file from these differences
patch.author: Author

compatibility.title: Compatibility
compatibility.compatibleDesc: Patch is fully compatible with this instance
compatibility.compatibleWithWarningsDesc: Patch can be applied, but there are warnings
compatibility.incompatibleDesc: Patch is incompatible with this instance
compatibility.alreadyAppliedDesc: This patch has already been applied to the instance
compatibility.selectInstance: Select an instance to check compatibility

backup.title: Backups
backup.backupModMessage: Worlds are backed up by '{mod}', we only backup mods and configs
backup.noBackupModMessage: Backing up mods, configs and worlds
backup.noBackupsDescription: Backups are created automatically before changes

resources.title: Resources
resources.searchHint: Find shaders or resource packs on Modrinth

profiles.gameplayOnlyDesc: Only mod configs (balance, recipes). Personal settings are not affected.
profiles.fullSyncDesc: Everything except personal settings (FOV, sound, keybinds).
profiles.minimalDesc: Only critical settings. Suitable for servers.

confirmSync.title: Confirm Sync
confirmSync.message: Settings will be copied from one instance to another. A backup will be created automatically.
confirmSync.warning: Personal settings (FOV, sound, keybinds) will NOT be changed.

advanced.title: Advanced Settings
advanced.excludeHint: File patterns to exclude (one per line)

collections.title: Mod Collections
collections.name: Name
collections.selectOrCreate: Select a collection or create a new one

wiki.localModNoWiki: Local mods don't have wiki content
wiki.author: Author

errorReporter.title: Error Reports
errorReporter.checkDuplicates: Check if this error has already been reported
errorReporter.selectToReport: Select errors to report on GitHub

connect.title: Stuzhik Connect
connect.subtitle: Share modpacks with friends instantly
connect.enableHint: Enable in settings to see friends online
connect.noPeersHint: Make sure you're on the same local network or VPN
connect.noServerRunning: Friend is not on a server
connect.vpnHint: To play with friends over the internet, we recommend:

network.title: Network Diagnostics
network.firewallBlockingDesc: Your firewall appears to be blocking connections. Allow the app to access the network.
network.noNetworkDesc: Could not determine local IP address. Check your network connection.
network.useVpnDesc: To play over the internet (not on the same LAN), use a VPN: Radmin VPN, ZeroTier, or Hamachi.
network.firewallHint: Run this command in an administrator command prompt:

settings.title: Connect Settings
settings.nicknameHint: Leave empty to use Minecraft username
settings.send: Send (what others can get from you)
settings.portWarning: Changing port may prevent finding friends

consent.warning: Only accept files from people you trust

radmin.name: Radmin VPN
radmin.description: Simple and free. Install and it works. Perfect for beginners, no registration required.

zerotier.name: ZeroTier
zerotier.description: Reliable and stable. Cloud-based, supports many devices. Registration required.

tailscale.name: Tailscale
tailscale.description: Modern and secure. Uses WireGuard, excellent performance. For advanced users.

hamachi.name: Hamachi
hamachi.description: A classic choice. Familiar to many, but has limitations in free version (5 devices).

console.forceKillWarning: Force stopping may result in data loss!

p2p.title: P2P Sync
p2p.description: Allows players to download server modpack via Stuzhik Connect
p2p.addressHint: This address will be shown to players for connecting to the server
p2p.requireInviteOn: Players must enter a code to join
p2p.requireInviteOff: Players can join directly (if they see the server)
p2p.syncFromClient: Mods from instance will sync with players (client mods filtered automatically)
p2p.syncFromFile: Modpack file will be sent to players, they can install it automatically
p2p.autoSyncHint: Automatically send modpack changes to all connected players
p2p.noAuthorizedPeers: Empty — all users can download modpack
p2p.authorizedHint: If empty — modpack is available to everyone. Add Peer ID to restrict access.
p2p.noInvites: No active invites. Create an invite so players can quickly join.
p2p.invitesHint: Send invite code to players. They can join via Stuzhik Connect.

welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.intro: Stuzhik is a modern Minecraft launcher that makes it easy to manage modpacks, servers, and game settings. The app supports Forge, Fabric, NeoForge, and Quilt mod loaders.

features.modsDesc: Install mods from Modrinth and CurseForge
features.connectDesc: Share modpacks with friends via P2P

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.intro: Follow these steps to get started with Stuzhik:

step1.title: Create an instance
step1.desc: Click the "Create" button and choose Minecraft version and mod loader

step2.title: Install Java
step2.desc: If the required Java version is not installed, go to Settings → Java

step3.title: Add mods
step3.desc: Open the instance and go to the "Mods" tab to search and install

step4.title: Launch the game
step4.desc: Click "Play" to launch the client or "Start" for a server

requirements.title: System Requirements
requirements.tipText: For modpacks, at least 8 GB RAM and an SSD for fast loading is recommended
requirements.javaText: Stuzhik automatically downloads and installs the required Java version. Here are the versions needed for different Minecraft versions:

overview.title: Overview
overview.intro: An instance is a separate Minecraft installation with its own mods, settings, and worlds. You can create an unlimited number of instances.

client.title: Client
client.desc: For single-player or connecting to servers

server.title: Server
server.desc: For hosting your own Minecraft server

creating.title: Creating an Instance
creating.intro: Creating a new instance takes just a few simple steps:

step1.title: Choose type
step1.desc: Client for playing or Server for hosting

step2.title: Select version
step2.desc: Choose Minecraft version and mod loader (Fabric, Forge, etc.)

step3.title: Configure settings
step3.desc: Allocate memory, set player name, and JVM arguments

loaders.title: Mod Loaders
loaders.fabricDesc: Lightweight and fast. Recommended for most mods
loaders.forgeDesc: Classic choice. Many mods, but heavier
loaders.neoforgeDesc: Fork of Forge with improvements. Modern alternative

structure.title: Folder Structure
structure.intro: Each instance has a standard folder structure:

backup.title: Backups
backup.intro: Stuzhik automatically creates backups before important operations:
backup.feature2: Manual backup creation at any time
backup.tipText: If you have a backup mod installed (FTB Backups, Chunk Pregenerator), Stuzhik will detect it and only backup mods and configs

sources.title: Mod Sources
sources.intro: Stuzhik supports installing mods from two major repositories:
sources.modrinth: Open platform. Fast API, quality mods
sources.curseforge: Largest catalog. Many old and new mods

installing.title: Installing Mods
installing.intro: Installing mods is as simple as possible:

step1.title: Open catalog
step1.desc: Go to the "Mods" tab and select "Browse"

step2.title: Find a mod
step2.desc: Use search or filters to find the mod you need

step3.title: Install
step3.desc: Click the install button. Dependencies will be downloaded automatically

installing.tipText: Stuzhik automatically detects and installs all required mod dependencies

dragdrop.title: Drag & Drop
dragdrop.intro: You can quickly add mods by dragging .jar files directly into the launcher window:
dragdrop.feature1: Automatic mod detection via Modrinth/CurseForge API
dragdrop.feature2: Connection to update system when detected

management.title: Management
management.bulkDesc: Select multiple mods for group operations

dependencies.title: Dependencies
dependencies.feature3: Incompatible mod detection via knowledge base
dependencies.tipText: Stuzhik knows about popular conflicts (OptiFine + Sodium, etc.) and will warn before installation

overview.title: Overview
overview.intro: The modpack editor is a powerful tool for managing builds:

bulk.title: Bulk Operations
bulk.intro: Work with multiple mods at once:

profiles.title: Mod Profiles
profiles.intro: Save different mod configurations for quick switching:

step2.title: Save profile
step2.desc: Enter a name and save the current configuration

step3.title: Switch
step3.desc: Select a profile for instant application

profiles.tipText: Create profiles: "Performance" (optimizations only), "Full" (all mods), "Server" (no client mods)

overview.title: Overview
overview.intro: Professional editor for modpackers — edit configs, datapacks, KubeJS scripts with IntelliSense:
overview.tipText: The code editor is under active development. Bugs and incomplete functionality may occur

intellisense.title: IntelliSense
intellisense.minecraftText: Stuzhik parses installed mods and provides autocomplete for item IDs, blocks, and tags.

recipes.title: Recipe Preview
recipes.intro: Visual representation of recipes right in the editor:
recipes.tipText: Hover over a recipe or click the preview button to display the visual representation

overview.title: Overview
overview.intro: Full Minecraft server management right from the launcher:

rcon.title: RCON
rcon.intro: Remote server management via RCON protocol:
rcon.tipText: RCON password is generated automatically and stored in server.properties. Don't share it with others

import.title: Server Import
import.intro: Import an existing server into Stuzhik:

step1.title: Select folder
step1.desc: Specify the path to the server folder

step2.title: Auto-detection
step2.desc: Stuzhik will detect MC version and loader

import.detectionText: Stuzhik analyzes server files and detects Minecraft version, loader type (Forge/Fabric/NeoForge/Quilt/Vanilla), port, and other settings.

overview.title: Overview
overview.intro: P2P system for sharing modpacks with friends without third-party services:
overview.tipText: All transfers are protected by end-to-end encryption. Even on local networks, data is inaccessible to third parties

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.intro: By default, all privacy settings are disabled — you have full control over visibility:
privacy.tipText: When you first enable Connect, you're invisible to others. Enable the options you need manually

security.title: Security
security.encryption3: Forward secrecy — new keys each session
security.protection1: Path traversal — validation of all paths

network.title: Network and VPN
network.intro: Stuzhik Connect works on local networks. For playing over the internet, you need a VPN:

vpn.title: Internet (VPN)
vpn.desc: Use VPN to create a virtual local network

network.radmin: Install and it works. Perfect for beginners

quickJoin.title: Quick Join
quickJoin.intro: Instantly connect to a friend's server with automatic modpack sync:

step1.title: Get code
step1.desc: Friend creates an invite and sends the code

step2.title: Enter code
step2.desc: Paste the code in the Quick Join field

step3.title: Auto-sync
step3.desc: Modpack downloads and game launches automatically

common.title: Common Problems
common.intro: Solutions for the most common issues:
common.memoryText: The game doesn't have enough allocated memory:
common.memory1: Increase maximum memory in instance settings
common.javaText: Make sure you're using the correct Java version. MC 1.17+ requires Java 17+, MC 1.20.5+ requires Java 21.
common.conflictsText: OptiFine is incompatible with Sodium/Iris. Use Sodium + Iris for shaders.

logAnalyzer.title: Log Analyzer
logAnalyzer.intro: Built-in tool for automatic game log analysis:

faq.title: FAQ
faq.a1: Install Sodium (for Fabric) or Rubidium (for Forge). Remove OptiFine if installed.
faq.a2: By default in AppData/Roaming/stuzhik (Windows) or ~/Library/Application Support/stuzhik (macOS).
faq.a3: Use the export feature in .stzhk or .mrpack format to transfer between computers.
faq.q4: Why does the game crash on startup?
faq.a4: Check Java version, memory, and mod conflicts. Use the log analyzer for diagnostics.
faq.a5: Select all mods (Ctrl+A) and click "Update". Or enable auto-update in settings.

stack.title: Tech Stack
stack.intro: Stuzhik is built on modern technologies:

shortcuts.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
shortcuts.tipText: In release builds, F12 doesn't work. Use Ctrl+Shift+D for developer console
